core.maker

Class OVClassManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.maker.OVClassManager

  • public class OVClassManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the actual class manager. It manages, trough a map, all the components classes and the key of its.
    Author:
    martino

    • Method Detail

      • addClass

        public void addClass(java.lang.String key,
            java.lang.Class<? extends OVComponent> c)
        Add a new class to the class manager. The key is used from the OVBaseMaker to associate the action to the correct Component class.
        Parameters:
        key - a more simple name used in the menus referring to the class
        c - the actual class of the component

      • hasClass

        public boolean hasClass(java.lang.String key)
        Method to know if a key string is in the key-set
        Parameters:
        key - the key string of the class. (used in menus)
        Returns:
        true if the key is in the key-set

      • hasClassByClassName

        public boolean hasClassByClassName(java.lang.String name)
        Method to know if a class (using the simple class name) is on the map
        Parameters:
        name - simple name of the class (class.getSimpleName())
        Returns:
        true if the class is in the map

      • newInstance

        public OVComponent newInstance(java.lang.String key,
                      OVContainer father)
        Create a new instance of a component using the key string to get the class.
        Parameters:
        key - the key string of the class. (used in menus)
        father - the container that will host the component
        Returns:
        the component. It will be null if the key is not in the key-set.

      • newInstance

        public OVComponent newInstance(java.lang.String name,
                      org.w3c.dom.Element e,
                      OVContainer father)
        Create a new instance of a component using the simple class name as key and a xml element to define it's own properties. (used for loading files and copy/paste)
        Parameters:
        name - simple name of the class (class.getSimpleName())
        e - xml element that define the properties of the new element
        father - the container that will host the component
        Returns:
        the component. It will be null if the class is not in the map
